data.description: A string path to .hic file as a string or a 3-column dataframe ofinteraction counts in sparse upper triangular format

resolution.description: A numeric specifying the width inbasepairs of each pixel. For hic files, "auto" will attemptto choose a resolution based on the size of the region. Fordataframes, "auto" will attempt to detect the resolution thedataframe contains. Default value \code{resolution = "auto"}

zrange.description: A numeric vector of length 2 specifying the rangeof interaction scores to plot, where extreme values will be setto the max or min. Default value \code{resolution = NULL}

norm.description: A character value specifying hic data normalization method,if giving .hic file. This value must be found in the .hic file.Default value is \code{norm = "KR"}

chrom.description: A string representing the chromosome of region to be plotted

chromstart.description: An integer start position on chromosome to be plotted

chromend.description: An integer end position on chromosome to be plotted

altchrom.description: A string representing the alternate chromosome for off-diagonal plottingor interchromosomal plotting

altchromstart.description: An integer alternate chromosome start positionfor off-diagonal plotting or interchromosomal plotting

altchromend.description: An integer alternate chromosome end positionfor off-diagonal plotting or interchromosomal plotting

assembly.description: A string specifying the default genome assembly or a\link[plotgardener]{assembly} object.Default value is \code{assembly = "hg38"}

palette.description: A function describing the color palette to use forrepresenting scale of interaction scores.Default value is\code{palette =  colorRampPalette(brewer.pal(n = 9, "YlGnBu"))}

colorTrans.description: A string specifying how to scale Hi-C colors.Default value is \code{colorTrans = "linear"}. Options include: "linear", "log", "log2", or "log10"

bg.description: A character value indicating background color.Default value is \code{bg = NA}

x.description: A numeric or unit object specifying square Hi-C plot x-location

y.description: A numeric, unit object, or character containing a "b" combinedwith a numeric value specifying square Hi-C plot y-location.The character value willplace the square Hi-C plot y relative to the bottom of the most recentlyplotted plot according to the units of the plotgardener page

width.description: A numeric or unit object specifying square Hi-C plot width

height.description: A numeric or unit object specifying square Hi-C plot height

just.description: The justification of square Hi-C plot relative toits (x, y) location. If there are two values, the first value specifieshorizontal justification and the second value specifies verticaljustification.Possible string values are: \code{"left"}, \code{"right"},\code{"centre"}, \code{"center"}, \code{"bottom"}, and \code{"top"}.Default value is \code{just = c("left", "top")}. Options include: c("left", "top"), c("left", "bottom"), "left", c("right", "top"), c("right", "bottom"), "right", "top", "bottom", "center"

default.units.description: A string indicating the default units to use if\code{x}, \code{y}, \code{width}, or \code{height} are only given asnumerics. Default value is \code{default.units = "inches"}. Options include: "inches", "cm", "npc", "snpc", "native", "mm", "points"

draw.description: A logical value indicating whether graphics output should beproduced. Default value is \code{draw = TRUE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE

params.description: An optional \link[plotgardener]{pgParams} object containingrelevant function parameters

quiet.description: A logical indicating whether or not to print messages. Default value is \code{quiet = FALSE}. Options include: TRUE, FALSE.\end}}\value{Returns a \code{hicSquare} object containing relevantgenomic region, Hi-C data, placement, and \link[grid]{grob} information
